ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to analyze and think about modern theatre and the post-dramatic.

I learned how to have to adjust to writing about something really out of the realm of what I had been introduced to in my academic career thus far: Polish absurdist theatre! Additionally, I learned about the genre and its history from our extremely knowledgeable professor.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Interesting material, the professor was engaged in her work and had a lot of interesting stories from her own work in theatre and knowing many of the theatre directors we studied.

Weaknesses: This is out of the professor's control, but the group of students were not very engaged in discussion and it made the small seminar difficult to get through. There were often moments of silence where the students wouldn't speak. I think that one way to improve this is to assign more readings and have a more structured class style, for instance asking for discussion posts on Canvas and being more strict about class participation.

I thought that the main strength of this course was its open-ness. Students were encouraged to bring their genuine thoughts and questions to each section. As for weaknesses, I don't really have much to say. Perhaps to add in some variety, we could have tried out some of the exercises that were used in the acting groups we studied.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I think the material is very interesting and this course has a lot of potential to be quite subversive. I wish we had gotten department funding to see The Mother in New York City, that would really improve the course. I also wish that the discussions of Polish history had been less superficial.
Yes! I think that this course is an excellent one to take because of the wealth of knowledge of the professor. Very interesting subject matter.
